column4: Hi there. I'm trying the new Ubuntu in a virtual machine. Apparently the user is logged out immediately after the boot is  complete. It's now looping between logging in the Live CD user and returning to the login screen. This a known problem? :)
why use virtualmachine? that's not a natural environment
not natural environment, sure, but no other version has done that.
actually, "not natural environment" is sort of a moot point, don't you think?
if the devs don't develope it for that intended virtual hardware, then nuff said
that's a bit of an easy way to talk yourself out of a very strange error that occurs only with the latest Ubuntu.
By the way, the new installer looks amazing guys.
Also, I see that the text anti-aliasing is now under different default settings, BIG +1 frmo me
feel however you want about it, but if you try submit a bug on launchpad, i'm sure you'll be ignored o.o

I'm not sure about that! Users should be able to expect that there are no serious system breaking defects in virtualized hardware, right? It's not like Ubuntu is developed "only for real hardware", especially since virtualization is rather popular in some settings.
they created the livecd for a reason, there's no reason to use anything else
if you are just wanting to test your hardware that is
look, regardless, my argument is that it doesn't work and yours is that you don't care about my use case. I don't think the developers would make that argument!
i highly doubt they would aknowledge it at all haha
but opinions are like allot of things, everyone has one
